top_note: This comprehensive restoration project addresses water damage originating in the kitchen that has affected multiple connected living areas. The scope encompasses complete interior restoration services including hardwood flooring replacement, paint restoration, trim work, and full kitchen cabinetry reconstruction to restore the property to pre-loss condition while maintaining Like Kind and Quality (LKQ) standards.
bottom_note: This restoration project requires the coordination of 4 specialized trades over 3 weeks. Industry standard and legal precedent establish that overhead and profit is owed when multiple trades are reasonably required for proper restoration. Professional project management ensures proper sequencing, quality control, and timely completion while maintaining safety standards and building code compliance throughout the restoration process.
disclaimer:
OVERHEAD (10%):
Our business overhead represents the essential operational costs required to deliver professional restoration services. This includes comprehensive multi-trade project management and coordination to ensure seamless integration between kitchen cabinetry, interior flooring, painting, and content management services. Insurance, bonding, and regulatory compliance requirements are maintained throughout the project to protect both the homeowner and the work quality. Equipment, tools, and transportation logistics cover the specialized tools and vehicles necessary for each trade, along with the coordination of material deliveries across multiple suppliers and installation phases. Daily site supervision and quality control oversight ensures that all work meets industry standards and building codes, while business operations and administrative support covers the professional documentation, scheduling, and communication required for a project of this complexity.

PROFIT (10%):
Our contractor profit margin supports the delivery of professional expertise and skilled craftsmanship across all restoration trades. This includes risk assumption and comprehensive warranty obligations, where we stand behind all work performed and coordinate warranty coverage across multiple trades and suppliers. Quality assurance and customer protection services ensure that the restoration meets Like Kind and Quality standards while protecting the homeownerâ€™s investment throughout the construction process. Business sustainability and skilled workforce development allows us to maintain a team of experienced professionals, invest in ongoing training and certifications, and ensure the long-term viability of our services to support future warranty obligations and customer needs.

items.name: Initial Site Survey & Precise Measurement
items.dec: Required for LKQ compliance - detailed field measurement of all existing cabinetry including non-standard dimensions, filler strips, and custom modifications

items.name: Template Creation & Field Verification
items.dec: Countertop and custom millwork requiring precise field templates for LKQ compliance

items.name: Comprehensive Surface Protection System
items.dec: Floor protection, wall covering, appliance masking for finished space preservation during cabinet work

items.name: Dust Containment System - Professional Grade
items.dec: Required for work in occupied, finished kitchen space per OSHA standards

items.name: Dishwasher - Detach & Reset
items.dec: Professional disconnection and reconnection including water supply, drain, and electrical connections

items.name: Refrigerator - Detach & Reset (Side by Side 22-25 CF)
items.dec: Careful removal and reset of large appliance with dolly and protection

items.name: Range - Detach & Reset (Freestanding Gas)
items.dec: Gas disconnection and reconnection per local code requirements

items.name: Garbage Disposal - Detach & Reset
items.dec: Electrical and plumbing disconnection/reconnection of disposal unit

items.name: P-trap Assembly - Detach & Reset (ABS Plastic)
items.dec: Plumbing disconnection and reconnection for sink access

items.name: Remove Existing Base Cabinets
items.dec: Careful removal preserving surrounding finished surfaces

items.name: Remove Existing Wall Cabinets
items.dec: Overhead removal with proper support and protection

items.name: Remove Existing Countertops
items.dec: Countertop removal including backsplash tile - excludes appliance areas

items.name: Remove Cabinet Contents & Reset
items.dec: Professional packing, storage, and reset of kitchen contents - larger kitchen

Matching Toe Kick Installation
items.dec: Custom-fitted toe kick matching cabinet finish

items.name: Cabinet Installation Labor Premium
items.dec: Finished space protection protocols, precision work, hardware adjustment, sequencing, material handling through finished spaces per LKQ standards - larger kitchen

items.name: Laminate Countertop w/ Bullnose Edge
items.dec: Template creation, precision cutting, edge work, fabrication, installation, sealing per manufacturer specifications - excludes range and refrigerator areas

items.name: Countertop Installation Labor
items.dec: Professional templating, fabrication oversight, precision installation, sink cutout, and sealing

items.name: Tile Installation Labor
items.dec: Professional tile setting, grouting, and sealing

items.name: Grout & Sealant Materials
items.dec: Premium grout and sealant for proper installation - larger area

items.name: Daily Cleanup Protocols
items.dec: Maintaining livable conditions during construction in occupied space - realistic timeline

items.name: Final Detail Cleaning & Inspection
items.dec: Comprehensive cleaning and quality inspection before occupancy - larger kitchen

items.dec: Careful removal of protection systems without damage to finished surfaces

items.name: Subfloor inspection and preparation
items.dec: IRC R503.1 requires subfloor inspection and preparation to ensure proper substrate for new flooring installation

items.name: Install hardwood flooring (Oak #1 common no finish)
items.dec: LKQ replacement matching existing hardwood throughout connected areas. DMV market rate per recent research showing $12.77-$16.19/SF range. 10% waste factor applied per IRC R503.1 for proper board layout and cutting allowance

items.name: Install hardwood underlayment
items.dec: Manufacturer specifications require proper underlayment for hardwood installation. Updated DMV market rate. 10% waste factor applied for cutting and fitting

items.name: Remove existing baseboard
items.dec: Baseboard removal required for proper flooring installation per industry standards

items.name: Install new baseboard (3.5" painted wood)
items.dec: LKQ replacement matching existing profile. 10% waste factor applied for proper cutting and fitting

items.name: Remove existing quarter round
items.dec: Quarter round removal required for flooring replacement

items.name: Install new quarter round (stained wood)
items.dec: LKQ replacement matching existing stained wood profile. 10% waste factor applied

items.name: Paint walls and ceiling (1 coat)
items.dec: Color matching restoration required due to water mitigation containment damage. Single coat adequate for color continuity over existing paint base

items.dec: Heavy furniture including dining table, chairs, and china cabinet require professional moving for flooring replacement access. Standard content manipulation for complete flooring replacement

items.name: Project-wide dust containment system
items.dec: EPA RRP Rule requires comprehensive dust containment for multi-room construction work. Professional dust barrier system with daily maintenance for 12-day project duration

items.name: Hallway protection during material transport
items.dec: OSHA walking/working surface standards require protected access for safe material transport

items.name: Kitchen cabinet and countertop debris
items.dec: Professional removal of kitchen cabinetry, countertops, and backsplash materials from work areas to dumpster location

items.name: Flooring and trim debris
items.dec: Labor cost for removal of hardwood flooring, trim materials, and installation waste from multiple rooms to dumpster location

items.name: 20-yard dumpster rental (15 days)
items.dec: Appropriate dumpster size for estimated debris volume with extended rental period for coordinated kitchen and interior finish work

items.dec: Daily cleanup of work areas to maintain safe working conditions per OSHA standards and prevent debris accumulation during multi-phase construction with content coordination

items.dec: Comprehensive post-construction cleaning including dust removal, surface cleaning, and preparation for occupancy per industry standards. Enhanced cleaning required due to content manipulation

items.dec: Detailed cleaning of all installed fixtures, trim, and surfaces to remove construction residue and prepare for furniture reset

items.name: Project-wide dust barrier maintenance
items.dec: Daily inspection and maintenance of dust containment systems per EPA RRP requirements. Extended duration due to coordinated kitchen and interior finish work
